intro: Impatiens lanessanii, commonly known as the Lanessanii Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the genus Impatiens, which is part of the family Balsaminaceae. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It prefers shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Its seeds are dispersed by the explosive force of its seed pods, a feature common among members of the genus.
